intro: Rhytidostemma peruvianum, commonly known as the Peruvian star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its bulbs are an important part of its reproductive cycle. Due to habitat loss, it is considered threatened in some areas, making conservation efforts essential for its survival.
